summary: The bill, the Improving Police Critical Aid for Responding to Emergencies Act (Improving Police CARE Act), amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968. It mandates performance standards for trauma kits purchased using federal funds under the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program. The Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance, in consultation with various stakeholders, will develop these standards which will include specific required components and optional best practices for law enforcement agencies regarding training, deployment, and maintenance of the kits.
